archimate:ArchimateDiagramModel.name: Technology Strategy
archimate:ArchimateDiagramModel.documentation:
The Technical Strategy (sometimes referred to as IT Strategy) describes how technology will be used to support and enable the business strategy. It addresses the direction of platforms, standards, innovations, and IT investments.
Role in Architecture Vision:
• Ensures that proposed architecture is feasible and aligns with future technology roadmaps. • Helps assess technical risks, constraints, and opportunities. • Influences the choice of architecture frameworks, tools, and reference models.
Typical Inputs:
• Enterprise IT strategy and roadmaps • Technology standards and policies • Legacy system evaluations • Security and compliance requirements • Cloud strategy, DevOps, AI/ML adoption plans • Enterprise architecture reference models (e.g., TOGAF TRM)
Output Influence:
• Informs technology constraints in the Architecture Vision • Shapes Solution Building Block considerations (early) • Establishes alignment with target technical state • Highlights key areas for innovation or modernization
